plugins.description:

Transform frames into professional animations and export them in various formats like HTML5, GIF, and MP4, optimizing your workflow for high-demand tasks.


Key Features:

  1. Quick Animation Creation: Automatically generate animations from frames with minimal effort.
  2. Multiple Export Formats: Export your animations in HTML5, GIF, and MP4 formats.
  3. Customizable Timing: Set precise frame timings for smooth and accurate animations.
  4. User-Friendly Interface: Easy to use interface with intuitive tools and drag-and-drop functionality.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Streamline your design process to meet tight deadlines and high volume requirements.
  6. Save & Reuse Projects: Save local copies of your projects for future editing and reuse.
  7. Cross-Platform Compatibility: Seamlessly integrate with ad servers and digital platforms for fast publication.


Documentation and Tutorials:

Visit https://willabs.com.br/bannerbolt

plugins.name: Figma to Flashtalking
plugins.description:
The Figma to Flashtalking plugin is a quick and easy way to convert your Figma project into Dynamic Flashtalking files without needing to write a single line of code.


Full documentation for the plugin can be found on our Help Center.


Key Features

  1. Export Figma projects as Flashtalking-ready ads.
  2. Add robust animations to each layer of your Figma project to create eye-catching movement.
  3. Create dynamic layers with the click of a button and easily tweak elements to be pixel perfect through the dynamic CSS variable.
  4. Use Quick/Full Preview buttons to review ad changes at any point. Previews display and function as they would in the Flashtalking system.
  5. Supports Richload or Standard ads.
  6. Upload your own custom font files.
  7. Files are developer friendly and easy to update post-export.
  8. Save and load your configurations at any point using the Save/Load Plugin Data buttons.


Setting up your Figma Project

The Figma to Flashtalking plugin works by allowing you to specify which elements within your project you want to make dynamic.


Before using the plugin, ensure your Figma project files are set up correctly.

  1. Ads will be determined by the Frame they are contained within.
  2. Frame dimensions need to reflect the desired ad size.
  3. Only layers with live text will be available for dynamic text variable assignment.
  4. Text boxes should not contain multiple font sizes.
  5. Arrow shapes are not supported.


Feedback & Bug Reporting

Have you found an issue or a bug that is keeping you from exporting your ads the way you intended? Have a feature you'd like to see in this plugin? Let us know by reaching out to customsolutions@mediaocean.com.

accepted.name: Flashtalking
accepted.description: The leading global independent ad server for sophisticated marketers.

plugins.tagline: Easily convert your Figma creations into Flashtalking dynamic ads.

Thatâ€™s why we built Magical Blocks, a tool that lets you generate custom, production-ready UI component libraries from Figma. Plus, our developer tooling makes it easy for your team to adopt. Take your design system to the next level with clean, reusable code components.


How it works

  • Use the plugin to export from Figma to Magical Blocks
  • In the Magical Blocks dashboard, categorize your assets (like button or toast)
  • Create a package with your categorized assets and hit Publish
  • Magical Blocks generates a developer-friendly iOS package
  • Start building!


Magical Blocks is currently in alpha. We're looking for folks to help alpha test Magical Blocks. If you're passionate about design systems and collaboration between designers/developers, come get early access at magicalblocks.com.

plugins.name: Design Assistant
plugins.description:
You must be an enterprise customer of Evinced to use this plugin. To become a customer of Evinced, contact us.


Evinced Design Assistant is the most powerful accessibility tool available for designers. It works for both design system components and page layouts.


Other accessibility tools for designers today are limited mostly to visual issues like color contrast and text readability. But true accessibility for a design requires that it work for screen reader, keyboard, and voice control users. Evinced Design Assistant can handle that for you, without the need for painful manual testing or having to know any of the complicated underlying technical issues.


Features:

  1. ARIA Pattern Analysis. Weâ€™ll help you match your component design to one of the ARIA patterns developed by the W3C. Then, Evinced will help ensure that your component has everything needed to be fully accessible.
  2. Keyboard & Screen Reader Analysis. Evinced checks (and helps you manage) issues like focus order, landmarks, and headings.
  3. Visual Analysis. Evinced also checks for (and helps you manage) traditional visual issues like alt text, color contrast, text readability, and tappable area.
  4. Developer Instructions. Once your design is finalized, Evinced will automatically compose developer instructions inside your Figma file for a perfect handoff.
  5. Unit Tests. Evinced will even include model code in your file to help your developer perform unit tests once the design is engineered.


Design Assistant is all you need, in one convenient plugin, to get to nearly 100% compatibility with assistive technologies and be compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines. Itâ€™s for designers at companies who want to get accessibility right.


Learn more at evinced.com

accepted.name: Evinced
accepted.description: The software for Accessible Development.  Evinced helps designers, developers, QA engineers, and managers prevent, detect, and fix accessibility bugs.

plugins.tagline: The most powerful accessibility tool for designers.

plugins.name: Base page setup for design files
plugins.description:
Usage

Create a new Figma design file then run this plugin to start off with a set of organized pages. (the plugin will create the pages then remove the default "Page 1" from your file, so make sure its empty)


Context

Our team likes to use this structure to organize pages in our files because it helps separate the different stages of the design process, this plugin creates all the base pages needed in one click.


Each page serves as a "header" for all the sub pages that go in that section and an empty page is added in between each for spacing and readability purposes.


Page Structure:


--- Final ---

-

--- Iterating designs ---

-

--- Ideating ---

-

--- Research ---

-

--- Cover --- 


Suggested use of structure

Below each of the headers add your pages that fall into that stage:

  • Final: final designs ready for handoff
  • Iterating designs: working files of hifi design explorations and versioning.
  • Ideating : rough mocks, flow diagrams, wireframes, rough explorations.
  • Research: key info from interviews, PM notes, references, inspiration, competition analysis, etcâ€¦
  • Cover: for the project cover.
plugins.tagline: Run this plugin after creating a new file to create a base set of pages for a design project

plugins.name: Bulk Font Replacer
plugins.description:
Bulk Font Replacer is a powerful Figma plugin that allows you to quickly and efficiently replace fonts across multiple text layers in your designs. Whether you're updating your project's typography or switching between font families, this plugin streamlines the process by replacing fonts in bulk, saving you time and effort.


With Bulk Font Replacer, you can:


  1. Replace fonts across all selected text layers at once.
  2. Handle both single-style and mixed-style text layers.
  3. Automatically skip unavailable fonts and notify you of any issues.
  4. Get real-time progress updates as fonts are replaced throughout your design.

Perfect for designers working on large projects with multiple font styles, Bulk Font Replacer ensures that your typography updates are consistent and hassle-free.


Features:

  1. Bulk replace fonts with ease.
  2. Error handling for unavailable fonts with fallback options.
  3. Real-time progress notifications.
  4. Support for multi-style text layers.

Make your font management more efficient with Bulk Font Replacer, the ultimate tool for large-scale font replacements in Figma!


Review on Product Hunt
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly replace fonts, everywhere.

Easily create, replace, or translate data in your Figma files.


This plugin is a practical, easy way to use AI to generate data for your Figma projects and wireframes. The plugin excels at data formatted in horizontal rows like a spreadsheet - perfect for representing data tables, inventories, price lists, work lists, and any other layout that features classic columns and rows of data. You supply the table design. The plugin will fill it up with data that is as generic or specific as you need it to be.


The plugin supports three modes - Create data, Replace data, and Translate.


Here is a playground file for you to try it out.


In "Create" mode, you will be inserting new text layers on your canvas or in a selected frame based on column headers that you select. Additionally, you can use the Prompt field to provide additional instructions or context - for example if you want the generated data to reflect a specific industry or topic. The resulting data follows the formatting of your column headers, but of course you can format the data any way you want.


"Replace" mode allows you to select a table component or instance - such as a template - and replace the text layers inside it with newly generated data. For example, if your template has "Text" in every data cell, the plugin will replace "Text" with data that you request (also reading your column headers and prompt).


The plugin also stores your recent prompts for easy recall and reuse.


Translate mode allows you to select text layers, frames, or components and have the text translated to a target language. Translate works with any selected text layers, frames or components, not just those in a table.


Additional notes:


  • This version of the plugin generates data formatted into horizontal rows like a spreadsheet.
  • Results are returned from a custom GPT engine optimized to generate results in table format.
  • You can request data for nearly any domain - factual or fictional.
  • The plugin will not return sensitive, protected, inappropriate or private data.
  • There are no set limits to the number of rows and columns the plugin can manage, but there are practical limits based on the underlying AI engine. As this technology improves over time, so will the performance and scale of this plugin.
  • Most requests for table data of about 25 rows or less should return successfully within a minute.
  • The response time will depend on the complexity of the request and the amount of data requested.
  • You can get more rows if you have fewer columns; conversely, you can generate more columns by requesting fewer rows.
  • If your request is not working, try triming back your table's dimensions or the number of rows requested.


Working with prompts:

Your table's column headers are evaluated by the AI to create matching data. E.g. a column header of "Date" will produce dates with no further instructions. If you want your date field to be formatted in a specific way or to tell a story, you can use the Prompt field to provide those instructions, such as "Date field in MM-DD-YYYY format."

  • A prompt is optional. Sometimes the column headers alone are descriptive enough to generate presentable data.
  • The prompt field is there to allow you to guide the results more specifically. There are many, many uses for a prompt. Here are just a few:
  • Only valid values from a reference list that you supply in the prompt.
  • Distribution percentages of values. E.g. if your table has an "availability" column, you can tell the AI that you want 20% of the items in your list to be "Out of stock."
  • Language; e.g. "All results in Spanish"
  • The Prompt History feature keeps your last 25 different prompts so that you can reuse them by copying and pasting.
  • Only new or edited prompts are saved. Using the same prompt repeatedly will not count towards the 25.


Enjoy!

plugins.name: Icon Tagger
plugins.description:
Make your icons easier to find with AI

Icon Tagger is a Figma plugin that generates keywords for your icons with AI and adds them to component descriptions, making it easier to find them.


ğŸ¬ View demo (52sec)


How does it work?

The plugin will process your icons and update component descriptions with synonyms related to your icon name.

1. Open the Icon Tagger plugin.

2. Select icon components.

3. Press the â€œCreate tagsâ€ button.

4. After processing, synonyms of the icon names will be added to the component description.


Multiple languages supported

You can generate synonyms for your icons in 9 languages: English, Spanish, French, Polish, German, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian!


FAQ


Is it free?

You can test the plugin on five icons for free. You will need to purchase credits to use it on more icons. The plugin uses Anthropicâ€™s Claude 3 Sonnet. Large-language models cost quite a bit of money to run. We must cover our costs to grow Icon Tagger sustainably without compromising our service quality.


What is the cost of the credits?

- Each icon you process uses one credit.

- You pay $5 once to get the plugin.

- Then, depending on the credits variant you selected:

  1. you pay $5 monthly for up to 2000 icon processings based on your usage
  2. or $10 monthly for up to 4000 icon processings based on your usage

- For example, if you process 1000 icons (use 1000 credits), you will pay 2.5 USD at the end of the month.

- If you process 2000 icons, you'll use all your credits for that month and pay 5 USD at the end of the month.


How do I prepare my icons for processing to get the best results?

The plugin generates synonyms for your icons based on their names. For the best results, temporarily rename your icons for the synonym generation process. For example, rename 'Icon / StarFilled' to â€˜icon/starâ€™ or â€˜starâ€™.


How many icons can I process in one go?

You can process a maximum of 200 icons at a time. After processing 200 icons, you can move on to the next 200 icons, and so on.


Does the plugin overwrite the description of the icon component?

No. The plugin will inject the newly generated synonyms above your previous component description.

accepted.name: Matt Wierzbicki
accepted.description: Product designer and entrepreneur running multiple projects.

plugins.name: Tolgee localization
plugins.description:
Easily manage translations within your Figma design files by connecting Figma with Tolgee localization platform. With Tolgeeâ€™s Figma plugin, the localization team can save time, simplify collaboration, and reduce errors in their localization process.


Tolgee is open-source developer & translator friendly web-based localization platform.


With Tolgee Figma Plugin you can:


  1. Push seamlessly your translations from Figma to Tolgee
  2. Pull your translations from Tolgee back to your Figma designs
  3. Switch languages in your Figma designs
  4. Create page copies with key names or translations
  5. Upload screenshots


Simplify your localization process with our plugin that allows you to seamlessly synchronize text with screenshots from Figma to Tolgee. Connect existing keys, pull translations, and create page copies with ease. Save time and improve efficiency with Tolgee Figma plugin! Learn more


How to Set Up Tolgee Figma Plugin


1. Create project in Tolgee platform

Go to Tolgee Cloud app or access your self-hosted instance and create a project. Then obtain your API key.


2. Install Figma plugin

First, you need to install the plugin from the Figma Community by clicking on the Try it out button. Alternatively, you can find the plugin in Figma by opening the Resources > Plugins, searching for "Tolgee", and then click Run.


3. Setup Figma plugin

After installing and launching the plugin, you need to insert the API key you created previously.

You can then select the language of the Figma file, the default namespace for new keys (if you use namespaces), and whether to hide the namespace selector.

Then click Save, and you are now ready to use the plugin!


Explore more in our documentation.


Want to see Tolgee Figma plugin in action? Request a demo.

accepted.name: Tolgee Team
accepted.description:
Smart platform.
Fast integration.
Painless localization.

plugins.tagline: Tolgee localization in Figma documents.

plugins.name: Get It
plugins.description:
Get It helps in building Figma plugins by letting you prototype pieces of your plugin in Figma and copy their verbose syntax to your clipboard. 

Want to get the fill syntax for a hex value or a complex gradient to use in your plugin? Select a node with the fill you want and run `Get It > Get Fills` and you now have a usable fill syntax in your clipboard.

Writing a complex drop shadow in your plugin? Quickly build it in Figma and run `Get It > Get Effects` and you have youâ€™ll have the full effect syntax in your clipboard

Donâ€™t know the exact font name for the font you want to load? Create a text node and assign the font you want then run `Get It > Get Font` and, you guessed it, the correct font name syntax will be in your clipboard. 

Creating a layout grid within your plugin? Do it visually in Figma and run Get It > Get Layout Grid.  ğŸ’¥ Layout grid syntax in your clipboard.

What you can currently get for a selected node:

- Fills
- Strokes
- Effects
- Font Name
- Text Styles
- Dimensions
- Offsets
- Layout Grids
- Constraints

Note: The selected node must have the property set on it to get it, for example, a rectangle node will not return a font name.

plugins.name: Font-o-matic
plugins.description:
Creating a custom font couldn't be any simpler:

  1. Arrange your characters horizontally in this specific order: capital letters A-Z, lowercase a-z, digits 0-9, and punctuation characters !@#$%^&*()_+-={}[]|\:;"'<>,.?/`~ (there should be a total of 94)
  2. Launch Font-o-matic and select all 94 characters
  3. Specify a name for the font family, select the font weight, and optionally adjust the sidebearings
  4. Press "Forge Font"
  5. Click the "Download" link in the confirmation dialog


Support for additional languages and glyphs:

As of v3, Font-o-matic supports the addition of any Unicode characters you want to include in your font:

  1. Align any additional glyph shapes after the required 94. The order of the additional shapes does not matter.
  2. Label each shape layer (for the additional glyphs) with either a) the Unicode name in the format 'U+xxxx' or b) the single Unicode character it represents.
  3. Select all of your shapes, and the button should indicate how many of the required shapes plus how many extra shapes are selected.


Some helpful tips:

  1. Make sure the 94 required characters are in the correct order, or they will mismatch the unicode characters they're assigned to in the font.
  2. Properly scale all of your characters beforehand, and make sure they are proportionally sized relative to each other.
  3. The spacing between your characters does not matter, but the relative vertical alignment of your characters does and is taken into account when the plugin calculates the baseline, x-height, cap height, ascender and descender measurements. For example, your commas and periods should be close to the baseline of your letters.
  4. The larger your characters are, the less the calculations need to scale up your letters, and therefor the more precise your alignment will be. The emsquare that the plugin uses is 1000 units, so at 1000 pixels it would be 1:1, though even at 1:20 (50x50px) you should be more than fine.
  5. Some text editing programs automatically replace quotation pairs with directional quotation marks. If you wish to support these unique Unicode glyphs, make sure to add them as additional characters with labeled layers (U+2018, U+2019, U+201C & U+201D). Alternatively, if you do not include these glyphs Font-o-matic will duplicate your single and double quotes into these glyphs as a fallback so that they will not get substituted for a system default font.
plugins.tagline: Generate fonts directly from Figma
